title: 70 Ideas for Summer Dates Your Partner Will Adore

steps.title: Water Balloon Fight
steps.content: Water Balloon Fight Turn into your inner child by tossing water balloons in your yard with your favorite person. Create some ground rules and pick a hot summer day so getting pelted feels refreshing instead of a sign of defeat. See who has the best aim and don’t take yourselves too seriously.

steps.title: Daycation
steps.content: Daycation Take the time to pretend you’re on vacation together from the morning to the evening. Make every meal special, whether at home or a restaurant. Or, head to a local hotel pool to transport yourself to a luxury retreat for the afternoon. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Dog Park
steps.content: Dog Park Most dog parks allow people without dogs to visit, which allows you and your date to spend time among a bunch of cute pups. It’s even better if one or both of you have a dog, so you can have them meet up on a playdate of their own and see how well they get along.

steps.title: Improv Class
steps.content: Improv Class Try your hand at learning the art of improvisation with your date so you can both let go and laugh. It’s a fun way for beginners to discover how to create storylines and plots on the spot without planning. Improv is the ultimate adventure when you want dates that get you out of your comfort zone. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Street Fair
steps.content: Street Fair Take your date to a local street fair where you can casually peruse clothing and specialty items made by small businesses. It’s also a great opportunity to sample a delicious variety of foods that you don’t see every day (and that won’t break the bank). Plus, you can stay as long as you like before easily moving on when you’re ready.

steps.title: Matching Tattoos
steps.content: Matching Tattoos You may only be ready for this summer date night idea if you’re already committed to your partner (or you know you’re in love!). If you want to recommit yourself to the person you adore, head to a tattoo shop and pick out a tattoo you can both get without experiencing any future embarrassment. Don’t forget to take a photo of your matching tattoos so all your friends can see how much you love each other!

steps.title: After Hours Playground
steps.content: After Hours Playground Wait until the kids have all gone home and head to a local park or playground with your date. Pretend you're kids again by climbing the monkey bars, taking turns going down the slide, or enjoying the swings together. The quiet time will give you a chance to get to know each other and have tons of fun while doing so.

steps.title: Waterfall Swim
steps.content: Waterfall Swim If you’re lucky enough to live near a waterfall or gouge, go for a swim at the location for unique date ideas for the summer. Swimming near fresh running water beats a swimming pool any day, so it’s a marvelous way to commune with nature together.

steps.title: Rooftop Bar
steps.content: Rooftop Bar You can take your date to a regular bar anytime, but summertime is the ideal opportunity to enjoy the fresh air and gorgeous view from a rooftop bar. Pick one that suits your tastes most, whether a bar overlooking the waterfront or one high up above the city. Have dinner or just stop in for a few drinks to elevate a normal date into a spectacular one.

steps.title: Bonfire
steps.content: Bonfire You can have a bonfire in your backyard under the stars without having to head far from home. Sing songs, roast hot dogs, and make the best s’mores you can, while watching the sparks fly in more ways than one.

steps.title: Watch the Sunset
steps.content: Watch the Sunset Catch the vibrant colors of a summer sunset with your date for an easy way to spend quality time together. Find a scenic place to watch the sunset over the mountains, the city, or the water. You can keep the moment between you peaceful, or bring along your favorite music or game as extra activities. Watching the sun go down is also a great option when you’re looking for date ideas for teens .

steps.title: Wishing Well
steps.content: Wishing Well Plan for this unique summer date idea by getting 100 pennies from the bank (or inside the couch!) and visiting a wishing well with your date. One by one, take turns tossing each of your pennies into the well as you make a wish. Share your wishes with your date and listen to the wishes they crave most. It’s a sweet way to understand what the other person dreams about for their life.

steps.title: Horse-Drawn Carriage
steps.content: Horse-Drawn Carriage Truly romantic types will appreciate climbing into a horse-drawn carriage for a trip around your town or city. You can both enjoy the summer sunshine while getting closer as you pass each new street corner. Pretend you’ve gone back in time just long enough to see the sights together.

steps.title: Brunch
steps.content: Brunch Meet for brunch early in the day so you can spend time together afterward. From fruity French toast to citrusy mimosas, this classic date option is wonderful in summertime, especially when you can enjoy brunch outside.

steps.title: Picnic
steps.content: Picnic Pack up some grub, grab a picnic basket and a few pillows, and head to a local park to bask in the sunshine. Your picnic in the park can be as low-key or fancy as you like. If you’re wondering what to do on a picnic date , try enjoying sandwiches and snacks, or take a 3-course meal with you to be enjoyed slowly over many hours together.

steps.title: Visit a Fair
steps.content: Visit a Fair Head to the local state or county fair for summertime fun with a crowd. Play games and win prizes for your partner, find out who can eat the most hot dogs, or catch some local live music. You won’t run out of things to do and can hang out for the better part of a day.

steps.title: Zoo
steps.content: Zoo Get closer by visiting a zoo where you can check out the local wildlife while holding hands. Feed the monkeys, admire the colorful birds, and watch the gazelles as they meander across an enclosure. It’ll feel like you’re on a faraway safari together when you’re only a few steps from home. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Comedy Show
steps.content: Comedy Show Get inspired to make each other laugh with late-night date ideas that include attending a comedy show. Pick your favorite comedian, try someone new, or go to a comedy night where you get to see a group of the funniest people around. After all, the couple that laughs together has a great chance of lasting.

steps.title: City Shopping
steps.content: City Shopping Turn a search for that perfect find into a shopping spree made for two. Decide where you’d like to focus your shopping energy (clothes, shoes, cars?) and spend time seeing if you both can find what you’re looking for (other than each other). Buy something for each other as a token of your appreciation along the way.

steps.title: Amusement Park
steps.content: Amusement Park Feel like a kid again by riding roller coasters and eating cotton candy at the amusement park. In summer, you might want to find one that has water rides to help cool you off after a day spent walking in the summertime heat.

steps.title: Hike
steps.content: Hike Summer is the ideal time to take a hike in nature, no matter how much time you have or your energy level. If you’re beginners, go for an easy, shorter hike that’s more focused on looking at the trees and flowers around you. If you’re both in the mood to sweat, climb a mountain or two on an advanced hike that ends up at a scenic and romantic lookout point.

steps.title: Beach Trip
steps.content: Beach Trip It’s incredibly easy to have fun at the beach while on a date. Take a joint surfing lesson, dine at the local restaurants nearby, or just build sand castles together in the sand. The quiet of the waves is a great excuse to talk and get to know each other better.

steps.title: Camping Trip
steps.content: Camping Trip Learn the art of pitching a tent with your date by your side for help. Decide where you’d like to set up camp and how you’d like to spend your time together. You can go fishing, build a fire, or cook up a delicious campfire meal together while chatting, listening to music, or telling scary stories that make you huddle together when you're scared.

steps.title: Paddle Boarding
steps.content: Paddle Boarding You can enjoy being out on the water without heading to the high seas by grabbing a paddle and hitting the lake. It’s easy to rent equipment and you don’t need a lot of accessories to make this outdoorsy date happen. Find out how well you work as a team to make it across the water in record time. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Music Festival
steps.content: Music Festival If you’re committed to a particular band or style of music, join up to go to an outdoor music festival. Listen to your favorite songs while under the sun or the summer stars; the music sounds better when you’re with someone you care about. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Cooking class
steps.content: Cooking class Learn how to make your date’s favorite type of food by enrolling in a cooking class together. Try something you’ve never made or learn how to perfect whatever you enjoy cooking most. Try your hand at the art of French cooking, pizza making, or elegant desserts. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Private Chef
steps.content: Private Chef Any meal you share with your date is special, but a dinner made by a private chef may be the most unique kind you can enjoy. Have a chef you admire prepare a unique meal you’ll both remember long after the date is over. Getting a private chef-made meal is one of the sweetest summer date night ideas you can plan for your special someone.

steps.title: Berry Picking
steps.content: Berry Picking Apple picking is for the fall, but in summer, it’s time to pick berries with your special person. From strawberries to blackberries, there are a ton of options when it comes to your berry of choice. Gather them up and head home to create a delicious dessert you can make together.

steps.title: Wine Tasting
steps.content: Wine Tasting An outdoor wine tasting can be one of the most romantic summer dates you can experience. Learn more about your favorite varieties of wines while you gain knowledge about the different notes each grape has to offer.

steps.title: Food Truck Crawl
steps.content: Food Truck Crawl Use the idea of a pub crawl to turn a date into an extravaganza of tasty treats from your local food trucks. It’s one of the best first date ideas that allows you to try a little something from each truck so by the end of the day, you feel as if you’ve been all over the world with your favorite person by your side. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Brewery
steps.content: Brewery Find out how your favorite summer brew is made by taking a tour of a local brewery. Discover the difference between a Pilsner and an IPA by enjoying samples, so you’ll know what to order on your next date.

steps.title: Virtual Class
steps.content: Virtual Class You don’t have to run around town to learn something new while on a date. There are endless possibilities with virtual classes you can take online. You can even attend a virtual class while your date does so elsewhere if you’re not able to be together. Then, you can meet up on a video call and commune about everything new you learned.

steps.title: Movie Marathon
steps.content: Movie Marathon No movie theater is needed when you stay at home and snuggle up with your date to watch as many movies as you can. An at-home movie marathon is a fun way to spend a rainy summer day while still enjoying each other’s company. Choose whatever film franchise or genre keeps your interest and stay close until the end credits.

steps.title: Backyard BBQ
steps.content: Backyard BBQ Pretend you’re having a backyard barbecue for a big crowd while keeping the celebration between the two of you. Crack open a beer or enjoy a glass of wine while grilling up delicious meats and making side dishes for the ultimate intimate backyard cookout.

steps.title: Game Night
steps.content: Game Night Stay in for an at-home game night built for two. Choose among board games or treat the evening like a trip to a casino by playing poker, blackjack, and 21. Allow yourselves to get competitive just long enough to see how much fun it is to play games in each other’s company.

steps.title: Happy Hour at Home
steps.content: Happy Hour at Home Achieve your dreams of being a mixologist by creating and preparing unique cocktails for each other. All you’ll need is two cocktail sets , some recipes, and a lot of creativity. It may be wise to share the cocktail you each create so you can make it until the end of the night! [8] X Research source

steps.title: Yoga Class
steps.content: Yoga Class Find a free or low-cost outdoor yoga class so you can both work out any kinks the week’s stress has left your bodies with. Grab a yoga mat and some water, and head to the coolest location for yoga available. Whether in the park, on a pier, or on a rooftop, outdoor yoga can be one of the most rewarding date ideas for the summer you’ve ever experienced.

steps.title: Visit Farmer’s Market
steps.content: Visit Farmer’s Market Take a stroll through a farmer’s market for a cheap way to see the best your local farms have to offer. You can treat yourself to a specialty baked good or try a new kind of fruit without breaking the bank; it’s more about the experience of getting out together for a fun-filled date. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Bookstore
steps.content: Bookstore When you’re both literary types, take advantage of visiting a bookstore that lets you browse without making big purchases. Enjoy some coffee at the cafe, flip through some books that interest you, and talk about topics you both love. You may even catch a writer giving a free reading if you’re lucky.

steps.title: Make Pizza
steps.content: Make Pizza An easy way to spend a fun date together in summer is by making a pizza from scratch. Work on perfecting your dough (or cheat with a store-bought one) and decide which toppings will work best. Or, you can have a friendly competition to see whose pizza creation wins out. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Ice Cream
steps.content: Ice Cream Summer is the season of ice cream, so choose how you’d like to enjoy this warm-weather treat. Go for an ice cream together, make some from scratch at home, or pair your ice cream with another activity, like heading to the beach or the park.

steps.title: Take a Drive
steps.content: Take a Drive Get in the car and head somewhere special together. You might just drive around town or to the beach, but make the point of the date your car ride. Take turns driving to surprise the other person with new destinations they’ll be sure to love.

steps.title: Stargazing
steps.content: Stargazing It costs absolutely nothing to sit beneath the stars with your date during the summer. Choose a clear night and a location where you can see as many stars as possible. Bring some wine, a treat, or games to play if you like, but there’s no telling how you’ll feel about each other on a beautiful starry night.

steps.title: Fireworks Show
steps.content: Fireworks Show It’s hard to go on a date if you are broke , but luckily, summertime is known for many fireworks displays you can take advantage of. Find the best spot to watch them and gather whatever you need to make it a good time all around. Then, sit back, get close, and watch in awe as a rainbow of colors shoots across a summertime sky.

steps.title: Volunteer
steps.content: Volunteer Date ideas in the summer can include ones full of meaning if you decide to volunteer together. Pick a cause you both believe in and dedicate a few hours to helping out there. Clean up the park, feed the homeless, or read to kids to find out what a wonderful person your date really is.

steps.title: Outdoor Play
steps.content: Outdoor Play Find some culture and possibly romance when you attend an outdoor play. You can look for free performances of Shakespeare in the Park or other local free shows that interest both of you. Combine your love of the theater with your favorite green space for a date they won’t forget. It also takes the pressure off when you’re nervous about what to talk about on a first date because the actors will do all the talking for you.

steps.title: Botanical Garden
steps.content: Botanical Garden Going to a botanical garden in the summer is like heading to a museum and garden all at once. Take in the beautiful greenery and flowers, which help create a super romantic environment for you both. Check out any special exhibitions like a lantern or cherry blossom festival for an even more beautiful surrounding for your date.

steps.title: Museum
steps.content: Museum Take in all the culture you can with a day-long museum visit to whisk you both away from your everyday lives. Visit special exhibitions and spend time looking at historical or natural exhibits that interest you most while learning about what your date is into.

steps.title: Flower Picking
steps.content: Flower Picking There are many summertime opportunities to go flower picking together that allow you to spend time outdoors under the sun. From sunflowers and roses to wildflowers, you can gather all the buds you can so you’ll have flowers to offer your date as a bouquet they’ll already have good memories about.

steps.title: Painting Class
steps.content: Painting Class Creative things to do with your girlfriend or boyfriend include taking a painting class that lets you both explore your artistic side. Whether you choose watercolors, oils, still lifes, or figure drawing, an art class can inspire you to find equally unique things to do on your next date. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Write Love Letters
steps.content: Write Love Letters If you’ve been seeing each other for a while or are a couple in need of cool date night ideas in the summer, try getting together to write love letters to each other. It’s a romantic way to get closer as a couple and express your feelings the old-fashioned way. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Mini Golfing
steps.content: Mini Golfing The best part about playing mini golf is that you get to do it outside. Summer is the best season to play a few rounds with your date, especially when you’re just getting to know each other. Have fun knocking the ball through windmills and exploring the entertaining course to see who is the king or queen of miniature golf.

steps.title: Go to the Lake
steps.content: Go to the Lake Spending an afternoon at the lake isn’t just about gazing out at the serene water. Lakes are a great chance to take part in many fun activities, like fishing, canoeing, and swimming, to hiking, boating, and waterskiing. Decide how you want to focus your day and make sure you leave time to chat along the way.

steps.title: Baseball Game
steps.content: Baseball Game Take advantage of the baseball season by attending a ball game with your date to cheer on your favorite team. Share some hot dogs and peanuts, and maybe you’ll even be lucky enough to catch a fly ball.

steps.title: Tennis
steps.content: Tennis If you’re feeling competitive, try a game of doubles to see who’s got the better serve. Tennis is one of those sports you can only enjoy outdoors in the summer. It’s also a great way to get exercise while getting to know the one you’re with. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Gardening
steps.content: Gardening You can take part in a fun summertime activity together without even leaving home. Plan a gardening project together that you and your date are both interested in, from planting an herb garden to choosing what vegetables you’d like to grow. This relaxing activity is a meaningful way for you both to spend quality time together.

steps.title: Work Out Together
steps.content: Work Out Together Fitness enthusiasts will enjoy doing double duty working out and going on a date. Sweat it out with the person you care about to prove to them how important staying active is to you. Treat yourselves to a delicious smoothie after you’re done hitting the weights. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Run a Race
steps.content: Run a Race If you’re preparing to run a race, challenge your date to come along for the ride with you. You can enjoy a series of dates where you train, do practice runs, and mentally prepare for a challenge you’ll both be proud of. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Try New Cuisine
steps.content: Try New Cuisine Let the coming of summer inspire you both to try a new type of cuisine when you’re next on a date. See what tapas are all about or enjoy having sushi made right in front of your eyes. Turn dinner into entertainment by stepping out of your comfort zone hand-in-hand. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Skinny Dipping
steps.content: Skinny Dipping When you’re feeling bold, pick a warm summer evening to go skinny dipping if you’re ready to. Make sure the body of water you’re swimming in is private and that you have permission to swim in the buff. It’s a carefree way to let go when you need a different kind of adventure while dating.

steps.title: Rock Climbing
steps.content: Rock Climbing Explore the heights with someone you care about by seeing how good you are at rock climbing together. If it’s impossible to do outdoors, many local recreation centers offer indoor rock climbing, along with rock climbing classes to get you started. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Skydiving
steps.content: Skydiving Prove to your date that you’ve got what it takes by heading into the sky for a parachute trip you won’t forget. Many skydiving businesses provide videos of your special memories and who knows—maybe you can even take the big leap together for the ultimate trust test.

steps.title: Road Trip
steps.content: Road Trip If a local drive won’t suffice, pack up and take a road trip for a date that goes on for days. Plan your date ahead of time and decide where you’ll stay once you get wherever it is you’re headed.

steps.title: Ziplining
steps.content: Ziplining You don’t need to go on a vacation to experience zip lining when it can easily become part of your next date. Adventurous types will love strapping on the ziplining equipment and shooting off into the sky. Impress whomever you’re with when they see you fly through the air with a big smile on your face. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Pool Day
steps.content: Pool Day Spend a serene summer day by the pool getting to know the person you’re dating while lounging in the sun and floating leisurely through the water. It’s a last-minute date idea that makes perfect sense in summertime. You can invite them over if you’re lucky enough to have a pool or head to a nearby public pool for summertime fun with other people.

steps.title: Outdoor Movie
steps.content: Outdoor Movie If you can’t find a drive-in, create an outdoor movie experience of your own that your date will appreciate. Screen your favorite movie on a blank screen or sheet using a projector and gather all the comfy seating and tasty snacks you can find.

steps.title: Couples Massage
steps.content: Couples Massage Longtime couples looking for a zen-inducing date night can find serenity by getting a couples massage. Not only will it relax your body and calm your mind, but you can also get to enjoy it alongside the person you love most. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Weekend Getaway
steps.content: Weekend Getaway If you’re reading to take the plunge, choose a weekend getaway for yourself and your date. It’s also a top choice for couples looking to break free from their everyday existence. Stay in a fancy hotel or a beachside resort until you forget all your troubles and can only concentrate on the person you’re with.

steps.title: Hot Tub
steps.content: Hot Tub The experience of climbing into a hot tub with your date is unlike any other you’ve had. The cool whirlpool of water is a wonderful break from the summer heat, which allows you both to cool off while getting to know each other better.

steps.title: Share a Hammock
steps.content: Share a Hammock One of the simplest summer dates involves nothing more than climbing into a hammock together. Make no other plans, except to get comfy, enjoy a cool beverage, and spend time with each other when the weather is nothing short of perfect.

steps.title: How do I spend the summer with my boyfriend?
steps.content: How do I spend the summer with my boyfriend? There are many entertaining ways to spend summer with your boyfriend, including outdoor activities like camping, going to the beach, or packing a picnic. Take advantage of seasonal events like food festivals, carnivals, or outdoor performances. The weather’s perfect to play sports outside or take a road trip together to explore new places you’ve never seen before.

steps.title: What is the perfect date for couples?
steps.content: What is the perfect date for couples? The perfect date differs for each couple, depending on their interests. Whether you take a class to learn something new and creative or prefer to relax with a meal made at home, the ideal date is one where you and your date can have a good time and get to know each other better. It allows you both to engage in conversation and open up to each other as much as you’re comfortable doing.

steps.title: Is summer the best time to date?
steps.content: Is summer the best time to date? Many believe that summer is the best time to date, because of the ample amount of outdoor activities, things to do, and seasonal events couples can attend. Others feel like fall and winter are better seasons to date if you’re looking for a serious relationship. Warmer weather seasons are associated with summer flings and casual romances, while fall and winter tend to be when people may be looking for a partner to get through the colder months with. [20] X Research source
